description:
As the Director of Mechanical Operations, you will be responsible for the end-to-end ownership of the mechanical supply chain that supports the entire portfolio of Google Hardware products. The broad scope of this role also includes ownership of the packaging supply chain across the entire Hardware portfolio.

You will lead a global team in the design, implementation, and ongoing management of an exceptional mechanical supply chain that takes into account the competitive dynamics and rate of innovation in the consumer electronics industry. As a leader of the business, you will also be responsible for the development of leadership talent within the organization in order to ensure that a robust pipeline of skilled leaders are available.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of operations experience.
  • 3 years of C-level experience in high-tech.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or Master’s degree in Manufacturing Engineering.
  • Experience sourcing highly complex mechanical parts in the consumer electronics domain.
  • Experience with surface finishing processes, including plating, anodizing, physical vapor deposition, painting, sand blasting, brushing, polishing, lapping.
  • Experience working with tier one mechanical suppliers, with the ability to directly own the commercial relationships, including negotiation of part and capital equipment pricing.
  • Consumer electronics experience.
  • Knowledge of core mechanical manufacturing processes, including injection molding, compression molding, metal injection molding, stamping, casting, forging, extrusion, CNC machining.
responsibilities:
• Design, implement, and manage the mechanical supply chain strategy to support the growth of the Google Hardware business.
  • Lead a team of Mechanical Operations professionals, including Global Supply Management, Supplier Quality Engineering, Manufacturing Process Engineering, and Tooling Engineering functions.
  • Collaborate with Product Design, Industrial Design, and Product Management throughout the product development cycle.
  • Be responsible for the mechanical manufacturing processes, delivery of parts meeting cosmetic and dimensional part quality specifications, and predictable supply throughout the product life cycle.
  • Create a culture that balances agility and flexibility to ensure that mechanical parts scale predictably in order to support product availability targets at launch.
title: Director, Mechanical Operations, Google Hardware
